page.title: 18CHANGING TIMES-PATCHWAY EAST
page.content: Joanne spoke to a lady who is 85 and has lived in Patchway all her life. She rmembers when it was all fields. As a housewife she had no modern gadgets. To clean her{carpets}she used a broom and tea leaves. She put it on the line and beat it with a carpet beater made of cane.{Clothes}were washed in the bath with soap and a rubbing board.{Meals}were cooked on open fire ranges. { Light}in the house was by paraffin lamps which had large brass bases. {Coal}was delivered at 14lbs.for 1d. {Milk}was bought from the milkman who pushed a two wheeled barrow which held a churn of milk. In those days 10p filled the cupboard with food. { Travel}was by hansom cab or in a horse drawn bus.
